Docs.summary: Signature generation using the DSA algorithm.
Docs.remarks: You are encouraged to use this class for generating all DSA signatures to ensure code portability with all DSA implementation. Some DSA implementations, like , provides some helper methods but these methods will limit your code to use this specific class.

Docs.summary: Compute the signature for the specified hash value using the DSA private key.
Docs.returns: The signature is returned in a 40 bytes array.

remarks.para: A will be thrown if a object instance hasn't been set in the constructor or by .
The hash byte array should always have 20 bytes as only the SHA-1 algorithm is supported.
The size of the signature, 40 bytes, isn't affected by the length of the public key (512 - 1024 bits).

Docs.summary: Set the hash algorithm to be used to compute the digital signature. For DSA the default (and only acceptable) hash algorithm is SHA-1.

remarks.para: This class only support the hash algorithm. Any name that resolves in another hash algorithm (or anything else) will throw a . This is a restriction of the DSA algorithm (FIPS 186) not of the class library.
